post_text:
Beginning Tuesday, September 8, LPSD will be providing bus transportation for in-town students.

The times listed for each stop are approximate and are subject to change depending on the number of students riding.

If you would like for your child to ride a bus, you will need to fill out the appropriate packet. You can get a packet from either the bus driver at a designated stop, or your child's school. These signature sheets should be turned in to the driver/school the next time your child rides.

If you have questions, call the transportation department at (501) 676-3382.

post_text: Thanks to local farmers and Bayer Fund, the Lonoke Public School District received an America's Farmers Grow Rural Education grant. We are excited to use these funds to enhance STEM curriculum by implementing a drone technology initiative to support research and development for more efficient crop production! #AmericasFarmers #BayerFund #GrowRuralEducation

post_text:
Parents and students:

We share, with one voice, the sadness and sorrow that our fellow Americans have been experiencing over the past several weeks. The Lonoke Public School District is proud of and places great value on the diversity in our community and our schools.

We are united in our purpose to provide equity for all students, staff, and parents and stand against inequity in all forms.

Unity To Build Community

Community Sponsored Senior Parade

A community sponsored senior parade is scheduled for Thursday, May 7th @ 2pm. Matt Edwards said it would be best if we could do the line up between the elementary & middle schools. The valedictorians and salutatorian will lead the parade followed by the honor graduates. The line will begin between the elementary and middle school. If you have any questions please contact Christee Whitehurst.

cwhitehurst@customtruck.com

post_text:
April 6, 2020 - Notice to Parents and Students

Parents and students,

Thank you for your support during this time. We know it‚Äôs been a challenging time for you, and we‚Äôre doing our best to provide needed support. During his briefing today, Governor Hutchinson announced that Arkansas schools would be closed to onsite learning for the remainder of this school year. We will continue with the AMI plan that we have in place. You will be notified of any revisions in the current plan.

As always, feel free to contact your building principals or the central office if you have any questions.

Many thanks,

John Tackett
Superintendent

post_text:
LPSD Parents:
If your child has medication at school that you want to pick up, then you can do so as follows:

Please contact Nurse Leah Robinson at leah.robinson@lonokeschools.org to request pick-up of needed medication. Nurse Robinson will schedule with you the date, time, and location for pick-up.

You will be asked to sign for the medication. Identification may be requested as well.

Once school is back in session, please remember to return medications to the school nurse.

Thank you for your understanding.

You will be asked to sign for the medication. Identification may be requested as well.

Once school is back in session, please remember to return medications to the school nurse.

post_text:
COVID-19 UPDATE: 3/13/2020 2:00 p.m.

During his press conference this afternoon, the Governor confirmed three more presumptive positive cases of COVID-19. We now have nine (9) in the state. According to the Secretary of Health, 70 tests have been performed up to this point.

Secretary of Education Johnny Key reassured us that schools are the best place for our students at this time but added that schools should be ready with robust AMI work in the event closing is necessary. Our district continues to make necessary preparations in the event any school closings are necessary.

Please continue to implement the prevention strategies we have shared with you. See our website for details.
text:
COVID-19 UPDATE: 3/13/2020 2:00 p.m.

During his press conference this afternoon, the Governor confirmed three more presumptive positive cases of COVID-19. We now have nine (9) in the state. According to the Secretary of Health, 70 tests have been performed up to this point.

Secretary of Education Johnny Key reassured us that schools are the best place for our students at this time but added that schools should be ready with robust AMI work in the event closing is necessary. Our district continues to make necessary preparations in the event any school closings are necessary.

Please continue to implement the prevention strategies we have shared with you. See our website for details.

post_text:
Covid-19 Update 3/12/2020 2:28 p.m.

Out of an abundance of caution, school districts in Grant, Jefferson, Pulaski, and Saline are closing at the direction of the Secretary of Health and the Secretary of Education.
In his press conference today, the governor emphasised caution against overreacting and advised we should not presume other school closings. We are in communication with neighboring districts and the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education, and we will continue to be vigilant. If you are concerned about or have symptoms of COVID-19, you are advised to call the UAMS HealthNow 1-800-743-36116. This number is also the number to call for suspected child cases.

post_text:
Parents, Students, and Community Members:

We are thrilled to announce that, because of your support for your schools and community, our millage proposal has been approved by the voters! The Lonoke Public School District Business Academy - Carver Campus will become a reality! Thanks to the hard work and vision of so many, Lonoke will not only build a strong workforce for the future, but will also ensure quality health care for our students, staff, parents, and all community members!
text:
Parents, Students, and Community Members:

We are thrilled to announce that, because of your support for your schools and community, our millage proposal has been approved by the voters! The Lonoke Public School District Business Academy - Carver Campus will become a reality! Thanks to the hard work and vision of so many, Lonoke will not only build a strong workforce for the future, but will also ensure quality health care for our students, staff, parents, and all community members!

post_text: Due to the nature of the illnesses that we are experiencing in the district, doctors in our school-based health clinic, located at Lonoke Primary School, will be seeing staff and students needing treatment on Thursday, February 6, 2020, from 7:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. As usual, the clinic will be closed Friday. Please enter through the main office to check-in.
text: Due to the nature of the illnesses that we are experiencing in the district, doctors in our school-based health clinic, located at Lonoke Primary School, will be seeing staff and students needing treatment on Thursday, February 6, 2020, from 7:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. As usual, the clinic will be closed Friday. Please enter through the main office to check-in.

post_text:
Parents and students,

We have been closely monitoring the number of confirmed flu cases in the district. We have found that, initially, the virus may or may not present with a fever, making it more difficult to identify early onset. If your child has symptoms, please make sure that you keep him/her at home until he/she is cleared by your physician or by our school-based healthcare team.

In that we have seen an increase in the number of confirmed flu cases in our schools, we are going to close school this Thursday, February 6 and this Friday, February 7, to contain the spread of the virus and to continue to disinfect all buildings and buses. We encourage our students to stay home, as much as possible, to ensure a healthy return on Monday. All students are expected to complete AMI work for the AMI days used Thursday and Friday.

Extracurricular activities scheduled for Thursday and Friday evening will continue as planned.

Please contact your building administrator/s if you have any questions or concerns.

Thank you for your support.

John
text:
Parents and students,

We have been closely monitoring the number of confirmed flu cases in the district. We have found that, initially, the virus may or may not present with a fever, making it more difficult to identify early onset. If your child has symptoms, please make sure that you keep him/her at home until he/she is cleared by your physician or by our school-based healthcare team.

In that we have seen an increase in the number of confirmed flu cases in our schools, we are going to close school this Thursday, February 6 and this Friday, February 7, to contain the spread of the virus and to continue to disinfect all buildings and buses. We encourage our students to stay home, as much as possible, to ensure a healthy return on Monday. All students are expected to complete AMI work for the AMI days used Thursday and Friday.

Extracurricular activities scheduled for Thursday and Friday evening will continue as planned.

Please contact your building administrator/s if you have any questions or concerns.

Thank you for your support.

John

post_text: Lonoke School District would like to thank all the parents, grandparents, family members and students who came to the LES GT EXPO on Thursday, December 12th! You made it a huge success. The showcase consisted of projects completed by LES GT students. The third grade students showed their models of the Brain and slideshows that highlighted a particular part of the brain. Fourth grade students displayed dioramas of how to survive various Natural Disasters and also had slideshows that detailed what supplies to have, what actions to take, and stories of true survivors of natural disasters. The fifth grade brushed up on the various sciences that make up Forensic Science. They made posters highlighting experiments used in their field of study and slideshows that included pay scales, education, and evidence used in that field. The fourth and fifth grade also had Christmas STEM activities on show, and the third grade challenged their families with cryptograms. The students worked hard and were eager to show their products. Again, thank you for supporting the LES GT program!
text: Lonoke School District would like to thank all the parents, grandparents, family members and students who came to the LES GT EXPO on Thursday, December 12th! You made it a huge success. The showcase consisted of projects completed by LES GT students. The third grade students showed their models of the Brain and slideshows that highlighted a particular part of the brain. Fourth grade students displayed dioramas of how to survive various Natural Disasters and also had slideshows that detailed what supplies to have, what actions to take, and stories of true survivors of natural disasters. The fifth grade brushed up on the various sciences that make up Forensic Science. They made posters highlighting experiments used in their field of study and slideshows that included pay scales, education, and evidence used in that field. The fourth and fifth grade also had Christmas STEM activities on show, and the third grade challenged their families with cryptograms. The students worked hard and were eager to show their products. Again, thank you for supporting the LES GT program!

post_text: Mood boost is a 7 week program featuring 6 moods. Week 1 will feature a tasting of different moods and different foods that go with the mood. The 6 moods are smart, happy, calm, alert, confident, and strong. Each week we will focus on one mood and the food option will come with a wrist band of the chosen mood. The food options have key ingredients that make you feel a certain mood. At the end of the 6 week program if they collect all 6 mood wrist bands they will win a draw string bag.
text: Mood boost is a 7 week program featuring 6 moods. Week 1 will feature a tasting of different moods and different foods that go with the mood. The 6 moods are smart, happy, calm, alert, confident, and strong. Each week we will focus on one mood and the food option will come with a wrist band of the chosen mood. The food options have key ingredients that make you feel a certain mood. At the end of the 6 week program if they collect all 6 mood wrist bands they will win a draw string bag.

post_text: This past weekend, Mr. Moeller took two teams of students to a "Cyber Challenge/Capture the Flag" event called HighSchoolHack. This competition consists of students solving puzzles to secure what are called "flags". Students must use many facets of cybersecurity and higher-level problem solving in order to receive points for any problems solved.

Students must use many facets of cybersecurity and higher-level problem solving in order to receive points for any problems solved.

post_text:
Due to the prediction of flash floods, the District will be using a half day of AMI this afternoon. We will dismiss as follows:

LHS - 1:00 p.m.
LMS - 1:10 p.m.
LES - 1:10 p.m.
LPS - 1:20 p.m.

All activity trips and after-school programs will be canceled.

The District will be keeping a close eye on weather conditions overnight. Please watch the news in the morning or check the website for updates.

Let me know if you have any questions.

post_text:
Lonoke School District will taking a half day ami day on Thursday, April 18th due to flooding and to ensure safe transport of students home. All students will be served lunch before dismissal.

High school will dismiss at 12:00 noon, middle and elementary at 12:15 and primary at 12:30. After school activities today are cancelled.

If your child typically rides a bus to school and you brought them today, you should plan to pick them up

Thank you
text:

High school will dismiss at 12:00 noon, middle and elementary at 12:15 and primary at 12:30. After school activities today are cancelled.

If your child typically rides a bus to school and you brought them today, you should plan to pick them up

Thank you

post_text:
Busses will be running flood routes on Thursday, April 18th

Our bus drivers have been told to avoid driving on hazardous roads and will not be picking up students that live on these roads.

If you feel that your child may be affected by this please make other arrangements for getting them to school in the morning.

It may be safe to assume that if your bus is over 10 minutes late, your road has been considered unsafe to drive on.

shared_text:
THU, APR 18, 2019
Drunk Driving Accident Simulation
text:
THU, APR 18, 2019
Drunk Driving Accident Simulation

post_text:
This Thursday (April 18), LHS will be hosting a Drunk Driving Accident Simulation at 10 a.m. All LHS students will be attending. It will be on the football practice field and will last about one hour.

You may hear sirens from police, a fire truck, and an ambulance. You may also hear the med-flight helicopter. Don't be alarmed.

This event is held to show our students what can happen when someone drives drunk. We sincerely hope it will make a difference in our students' lives.

post_text:
UPDATE from Superintendent John Tackett:

Parents and students,
I have been informed by police that as of 10:00 p.m. Friday, three suspects connected with the the threatening message have been taken into police custody. My sincere thanks to the great work of our SROs and local police officers for providing needed support and follow-up. Many thanks to Chief Mauk for providing continuous assistance to our district.
As always, we will remain vigilant when it comes to the safety of students and staff. We are committed to providing an outstanding education and exceptional learning opportunities to the great students in the Lonoke Public School District.
Thank you again for your support.

post_text:
UPDATE:

Local law enforcement is pursuing all leads associated with the threat.

In cooperation with our police department, we have decided to dismiss school early today.

LHS will dismiss at 1:05 p.m.
LES & LMS will dismiss at 1:20 p.m.
LPS will dismiss at 1:30 p.m.
There will be no after-school programs today.

Thank you for your cooperation.

post_text:
Statement from Superintendent John Tackett:

We appreciate your patience and support. We have taken steps to ensure the safety of all students and staff today. Law enforcement is investigating the threat.

We understand your concerns and we respect that some of you chose to stay home. Your absence will not be counted against you today. You will be allowed to make up any missed work.

We will see you back at school on Monday.

DEADLINE EXTENDED: Envision applications now due April 30th.

Ken Grover, an expert in innovative education, is working with our schools to make this program possible. This is what we envision for Lonoke High School in the future!

For more information, see your school counselor. Their contact information can be found on our website: lonokeschools.org.

post_text:
Some exciting opportunities are coming to Lonoke High School! If your student would like to participate in the Envision program, they need to submit an application by April 1st. The program is open to current 8th and 9th grade students. For applications and more information, visit your school counselor's office. Their contact information can be found on our website lonokeschools.org.
